## Purpose
Provides width constraint functionality for Rich's rendering system by wrapping renderables with maximum width limits.

## Core Class
**Constrain (L10-37)** - A wrapper class that limits the display width of any renderable object
- Inherits from JupyterMixin for notebook compatibility
- Implements Rich's rendering protocol via `__rich_console__` and `__rich_measure__`

## Key Methods
**`__init__` (L18-20)** - Constructor accepting a renderable and optional width (defaults to 80 characters)

**`__rich_console__` (L22-29)** - Main rendering method that:
- Returns unconstrained renderable if width is None (L25-26)
- Otherwise creates child options with constrained width using `min(self.width, options.max_width)` (L28)
- Delegates to console.render() with updated options (L29)

**`__rich_measure__` (L31-37)** - Measurement method for layout calculations:
- Updates options with constrained width if width is set (L34-35)
- Uses Measurement.get() to calculate actual dimensions (L36)

## Dependencies
- Rich's measurement system (Measurement from .measure)
- Rich's console rendering protocol (Console, ConsoleOptions, RenderableType, RenderResult)
- JupyterMixin for notebook support

## Architectural Pattern
Implements the decorator pattern to add width constraints to any renderable without modifying the original object. Follows Rich's rendering protocol by implementing both console rendering and measurement methods.

## Key Behavior
Width constraint is enforced by taking the minimum of the specified width and the available console width, ensuring content never exceeds either limit.
